A while back I posted my famous chicken soup recipe.
Well, as luck would ha=
ve it I have again, created a rather delectable dish.

Saut=E9ed chicken br=
east with Extra Virgin olive oil, sage, garlic, lemon juice and salt.

1: C=
oat a large skillet with extra virgin olive oil.

2: peel about a half doze=
n cloves of garlic, and add them to the skillet.

3: Bring the heat up to m=
edium high on the stove.  Once the garlic begins to sizzle, lower the heat =
one notch on the stove.  Once the garlic colors slightly, remove it from th=
e skillet and put aside on another plate, and save it for the end of the co=
oking process.

4: while working on the garlic in the skillet, quarter thre=
e large chicken breasts and then slice them into kabob like pieces.  Once t=
his is done, drop it into the skillet and turn occasionally.

5: As the chi=
cken cooks, prepare a handful of fresh sage, and add it to the chicken when=
 it begins to have a light golden color.  Also re introduce the garlic and =
add salt, and lemon juice.  Saut=E9 until golden brown.

And then..  ENJOY.=
